greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) is the number of amenable quasi-idempotent order-decreasing partial one-one transformations (of an n-chain) of height k (height(alpha) = |Im(alpha)|).
comment: T(n,k) is also the rank of the semigroup of order-decreasing partial one-one transformations (of an n-chain) of height <= k.
link: A. Umar, On the ranks of certain finite semigroups of order-decreasing transformations Portugaliae Math. 53, (1996), 23-34.
example: T(3,2) = 6 because there are exactly 6 amenable quasi-idempotent order-decreasing partial one-one transformations (on a 3- chain) of height 2, namely: (1,2)->(1,2), (1,3)->(1,2), (1,3)->(1,3), (2,3)->(1,3), (2,3)->(2,1), (2,3)->(2,3).
program: tabl(nn) = for (n=0, nn, for (k=0, n, print1(T(n, k), ", ")); print); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 23 2018
xref: Row sums of T(n, k) is A005183.
results.author: _Abdullahi Umar_, Sep 30 2008
